intro: Drosanthemum giffenii var. intertextum, commonly known as the woolly rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant features dense, woolly foliage that helps it retain moisture in arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a distinctive tubular shape that attracts pollinators like bees and butterflies. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
